thread.title: 68 BSE500 stocks hit all-time highs in Feb; five stocks you can still bet on
thread.title_full: 68 BSE500 stocks hit all-time highs in Feb; five stocks you can still bet on - The Economic Times

author: Rahul Oberoi
title: 68 BSE500 stocks hit all-time highs in Feb; five stocks you can still bet on
text:
NEW DELHI: Financial stocks are rocking on Dalal Street this month, as 11 of them have hit fresh all-time highs so far. Shares of HDFC Bank touched a new high of Rs 1,450 on February 17 after hectic buying by overseas investors pushed their holding in it to the permissible limit soon after the opening of trade. 

The stock has surpassed Reliance Industries to become the country’s second most valued firm in terms of market capitalisation after Tata Consultancy Services (TCS). 

Other banking and financial stocks that touched fresh 52-week highs this month include IndusInd Bank , RBL Bank, Motilal Oswal Financial Services , L&T Financial Holdings, State Bank of Bikaner and Jaipur , Gruh Finance , YES Bank , Max Financial and Federal Bank . 

In all, 68 stocks from the BSE500 index hit their all-time highs in February. Oil marketing companies Bharat Petroleum Corporation (BPCL), Hindustan Petroleum Corporation (HPCL) and IndianOil (IOC) have also touched fresh highs this month. 



Other blue chip majors such as Maruti Suzuki and ITC also impressed the market with lofty performance. Maruti Suzuki and ITC hit new all-time highs at Rs 6,230.30 and Rs 291.95 on February 8 and February 7, respectively. 

CCL Products , Rain Industries, Thyrocare Technologies, Aarti Industries , EID Parry , KRBL , Mahanagar Gas, Sun TV Network , Dilip Buildcon, Indraprastha Gas , Bluestar, Cadila Healthcare , Biocon , Escorts, Caplin Point Laboratories and Aegis Logist are among the companies that touched fresh all-time highs this month. 



Stocks such as Hindustan Zinc , City Union Bank , Sharda Cropchem, Godrej Properties , Future Consumer, Mahanagar Gas and Trent are around 10 per cent away from their all-time highs of Rs 333.40, Rs 168.50, Rs 514.90, Rs 394.80, Rs 29.30, Rs 956 and Rs 270, respectively. 

Should you buy? 

Of all the stocks that hit fresh 52-week highs in February, market experts are bullish on stocks such as Maruti Suzuki, CCL Products, Indraprastha Gas Ltd , Sun TV Network and APL Apollo . 

Maruti Suzuki: Maruti Suzuki is one of the few companies to have bucked the weak trend offset by demonetisation because of strong demand for its vehicles, with key models like Brezza and Baleno still having a long waiting period. The recently launched Ignis model has also been well received by the market, with more than 10,000 initial bookings. According to Nirmal Bang Commodities, the Swift model’s upgrade is due which, coupled with Ignis and other key models are likely to drive 12 per cent volume growth for MSIL in FY18. 

“Following a robust product pipeline, we expect MSIL to report double-digit volume growth over FY17E/FY18E, driving market share gains for the company. We expect margins to remain around 16 per cent in FY17E/FY18E, which will drive double-digit earnings growth in the coming years. The stock price of the company can touch Rs 6,688 in coming months,” the brokerage house said in a research note. 

CCL Products: Nirmal Bang is bullish on CCL Products with a target price of Rs 405. “We expect sales, Ebitda and net profit to rise 20 per cent, 22 per cent and 27 per cent CAGR, respectively, over FY17E-FY19E with volume growth of 16 per cent over the same period,” the brokerage house said. 

The company is engaged in the manufacturing of instant coffee. CCL Products operates through the coffee and coffee-related product segment. It is engaged in the manufacture of soluble instant spray dried coffee powder, spray dried agglomerated/granulated coffee, freeze-dried coffee and freeze concentrated liquid coffee. 

Indraprastha Gas (IGL): The stock hit a new all-time high after the company reported 37 per cent year-on-year rise in net profit at Rs 144.81 crore for the quarter ended December 31, 2016 against Rs 105.85 crore in the corresponding quarter last year. Brokerage house HDFC Securities is bullish on IGL with a target price of Rs 1,200. 

The stock price has almost doubled in the past year, led by strong performance and multiple re-rating. “We expect margins to remain flat and a volume CAGR of 10 per cent. There may be no sharp uptick in the stock but it will provide steady returns,” said HDFC Securities in a research report. 

Sun TV Network: The Special 2G court recently dropped all charges of corruption and money laundering against the Maran brothers in the Aircel Maxis case. The promoters being involved in the 2G case had been a major overhang on the stock despite the broadcaster having return ratios superior to Zee Entertainment , which trades at far superior multiples. With the acquittal news, the stock witnessed a significant rally on the bourses. ICICIdirect.com said, “We feel the stock is yet to reflect its full potential. We value the stock at 24 times FY19E earnings per share (EPS) of Rs 35.4. Hence, we arrive at a target price of Rs 850 and maintain ‘buy’ recommendation.” Shares of Sun TV Network were trading at Rs 703 on February 17. 

APL Apollo Tubes: The stock hit an all-time of Rs 1144 on February 10, 2017. IIFL Private Wealth is bullish on APL Apollo with a 12-month target price of Rs 1,275. 

“APL Apollo’s Q3 FY17 performance was in line with our estimates amid demonetisation drive, reporting revenue growth of 21 per cent yoy driven by modest volume growth and robust blended realisation. Going ahead, we expect the adverse impact of demonetisation to continue in the short term. However, the improving demand from new end-use segments, coupled with the higher capacity coming on stream would be the key volumes drivers for APL in the medium to long term,” IIFL Private Wealth said in a note.
